content.question: Given independent events <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="the probability of A equals 0.3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the probability of A equals 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following is a correct statement?

choices.label: <math alttext="the probability of, A given B, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>|</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the probability of, B given A, equals 0.3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>|</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow><mn>0.3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the probability of, A given B, equals 0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>|</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the probability of, A union B, equals 0.65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∪</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the probability of, A union B, equals 0.80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∪</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the probability of, A union B, equals 0.65" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>∪</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.6: Independent Events and Unions of Events

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
